app.rdg: Mary then speaks further to the audience:

app.lem: O gij saligen lute,
app.rdg: Oh, you blessed people,

app.lem: Schowet dessen groten yamer hute
app.rdg: behold today this great misery

app.lem: An moder vnde an kynde!
app.rdg: of mother and of child!

app.lem: Seet, wo rechte swynde
app.rdg: See, how quickly

app.lem: (Hic tangit tercio.)
app.rdg: (He strikes himself a third time.)

app.lem: Symeonis scharpe douendyge swert
app.rdg: Simeon’s sharp, grim sword

app.lem: Dorch myne sele henne verd
app.rdg: cuts through my soul

app.lem: Vnde ok dorch myn bedrouede herte!
app.rdg: and also through my grieving heart!

app.lem: Desse bytterlyke smerte
app.rdg: The prophecy of this bitter pain

app.lem: Propheterede my her Symeon,
app.rdg: was revealed to me by Simeon,

app.lem: Do yk Jhesum Cristum mynen leuen so&esup;n

app.rdg: when I brought my dear son

app.lem: In den tempel godes brachte;

app.rdg: Jesus Christ into God’s temple.

app.lem: He sprak: o maget, nu wachte!
app.rdg: He spoke: “Oh, virgin, take heed!

app.lem: Du byst dynes modes nu so vro --
app.rdg: You are now so joyful —

app.lem: Id schal noch komen also,
app.rdg: it will come to pass

app.lem: Dat eyn scharp swert schal treden
app.rdg: that a sharp sword will cut

app.lem: Dorch dyne sele vnde dyn kynd dar mede!
app.rdg: through your soul and your child with it!

app.lem: Maria Johannis ewangeliste plangit post hoc et cantat
app.rdg: Mary, mother of John the Evangelist, then laments and sings:

app.lem: O godes kynt,
app.rdg: oh, child of God,

app.lem: Wo blodich synt
app.rdg: how bloody are

app.lem: Alle de hilgen lede dyn!
app.rdg: all your holy limbs!

app.lem: Dat gift myneme herten pyn.
app.rdg: That makes my heart ache.

app.lem: O du aller hogeste gud,
app.rdg: Oh, you highest goodness,

app.lem: Ik nu sere beweynen mod
app.rdg: I must now weep for

app.lem: Dynen groten swaren dot!
app.rdg: your cruel and terrible death!

app.lem: Owy vnde owe ouer vnsen not!
app.rdg: Alas and alack for our peril!

app.lem: Gheleden heft den swaren dot

app.rdg: Jesus Christ, our dear Lord,

app.lem: Jhesus Cristus, vnse leue here.

app.rdg: has suffered a cruel death.

app.lem: Leuen kyndere, helpet vns mede weynen sere!
app.rdg: Dear children, help us to weep!

app.lem: Beter were wij vngeboren,
app.rdg: TIt would be better if we had never been born,

app.lem: Worde syn hilge lydent an vns vorloren.
app.rdg: than that his suffering be wasted on us.

app.lem: Sancta Maria cantat post hoc
app.rdg: Then St. Mary sings:

app.lem: Fflecte ramos, arbor alta,
app.rdg: Bend your branches, tall tree

app.lem: Densa laxa viscera,
app.rdg: relax your broad limbs,

app.lem: Et rigor lentescat ille,

app.rdg: and may your native

app.lem: Quem dedit natiuitas,

app.rdg: stiffness relax,

app.lem: Vt superni membra regis
app.rdg: so that you may spread the limbs of the highest king

app.lem: Miti tendas stipite!
app.rdg: with a gentle trunk!

app.lem: Sancta Maria dicit et inspicit crucem
app.rdg: St. Mary speaks and looks at the cross:

app.lem: O du eddele bo&esup;m van hoger werde,
app.rdg: O noble and worthy tree,

app.lem: Boghe dy eyn kleyne to der erde,
app.rdg: bow down to earth a little

app.lem: Dat yk kussen moge den leuen sone myn!
app.rdg: so that I can kiss my beloved son!

app.lem: O wo drouych mot ik lange syn,
app.rdg: Oh, how sad I will be for a long time

app.lem: Dat ik synes nicht kan aflangen!
app.rdg: since I can’t reach him!

app.lem: O leue kynt, wo hoge bystu nu ghehangen!
app.rdg: O dear child, how high you are hung now!

app.lem: Ny quam creature in so grote not,
app.rdg: No creature was ever in such great peril

app.lem: Alse du, Jhesu Criste, o hemmelsche got!
app.rdg: as you, Jesus Christ, o Heavenly God!

app.lem: We kan dy des danken, o ryke godes kynt?
app.rdg: How can I thank you, child of the Almighty God?

app.lem: Troste my vnde alle, de nu vmme dy bedrouet synt!
app.rdg: Console me and everyone who is wailing for you!

app.lem: Johannes respondet
app.rdg: John responds:

app.lem: O eddele junckfrowe Maria vnde reyne maget,
app.rdg: O noble and pure Virgin Mary,

app.lem: Dyn herteleyt sy gode van hemmelryke geklaget!
app.rdg: your heart’s sorrow shall be lamented to God in Heaven!

app.lem: Vnse metelydent wyl sik nu ersten vornygen;
app.rdg: Our communal suffering will now truly reveal itself;

app.lem: Ik mot myt luder stempnen vth mynem herten scrygen
app.rdg: with a loud voice from my heart

app.lem: Vnde ropen myt dy in den hemmel, o Marie!
app.rdg: I will cry with you into Heaven, o Mary!

app.lem: Leuen vrundes, besuchtet vnde beweynet nu mede vnses heren dot,
app.rdg: Dear friends, now consider and bewail with us our Lord’s death

app.lem: Dat he juw behode vnde beware vor der ewygen helle no&esup;t!
app.rdg: so that he might save and deliver you from the threat of eternal hell!

app.lem: Johannes cantat et vertit se ad Mariam virginem
app.rdg: John sings and turns to the Virgin Mary:

app.lem: Maria, moder bystu myn,
app.rdg: Mary, you are my mother

app.lem: Jo byn ik de sone dyn.
app.rdg: and thus I am your son.

app.lem: Cristus myn meyster dy my bevalen hat,
app.rdg: Christ, my master, has given you into my care

app.lem: Went dyn heyl nu an myr stat.
app.rdg: so that your wellbeing is now responsibility.

app.lem: So lat, trud moder, dyn weynent!
app.rdg: Therefore, dear mother, stop your wailing!

app.lem: (Hic apprehendit manum beate virginis)
app.rdg: (Here he takes the hand of the Virgin Mary)

app.lem: Wo grot ys myn herteleyt,
app.rdg: How great is my heart’s suffering

app.lem: (Hic subtrahit.)
app.rdg: (Here he lets go of it.):

app.lem: Went ik see des yamers kleyt

app.rdg: when I see the the noble virgin

app.lem: An der werden junckfrowen schynen

app.rdg: wearing a veil of sorrow

app.lem: Myt so bytterlyken pynen!
app.rdg: with such bitter pains!

app.lem: Wultu doden my enen?
app.rdg: Do you want to kill me?

app.lem: God, here, meyster ys he myn,
app.rdg: To me he is God, lord and master,

app.lem: Jo byn ik de junger syn.
app.rdg: thus I am his disciple.

app.lem: He gaf dy to ener moder my,
app.rdg: He gave you to me as my mother

app.lem: Do toch he my to sone dy,
app.rdg: and hence chose me to be your son

app.lem: De wyle he leuede an deme crutze.
app.rdg: while he was still alive on the cross.

app.lem: Vp synen brusten yk vntsleep,
app.rdg: I fell asleep on his chest,

app.lem: Myn herte syne gotheyt grep:
app.rdg: my heart yearned for his godhead.

app.lem: Ik weyt, he ys van wyllen dot,
app.rdg: I know that he dies willingly;

app.lem: Myt wyllen let he de marter grot.
app.rdg: willingly he suffered great torment.

app.lem: Dat nym an dyn herte, sute!
app.rdg: Take that to heart, sweet one!

app.lem: Sulken trost han nu van myr:
app.rdg: Take such consolation from me:

app.lem: Ik wyl wesen eyn hoder dyn,
app.rdg: I will be your protector

app.lem: Wente my bevalen bist,
app.rdg: because that is what I was ordered to do,

app.lem: Vnde dyn heyl vorstoruen ist.
app.rdg: and your happiness has died.

app.lem: De prophecie ys vullenbracht:
app.rdg: The prophecy is fulfilled,

app.lem: He heft vorvullet des dodes macht.
app.rdg: he has embraced the power of death.

app.lem: (Hic apprehendit iterum manus)
app.rdg: (Here he takes her hand again.)

app.lem: Myt truwen yk dy meyne,
app.rdg: And faithfully, I have to bid you,

app.lem: So lat, trut moder, dyn weynent!
app.rdg: dear mother, to stop crying.

app.lem: Maria, medder vnde moder myn,
app.rdg: Mary, my aunt and mother,

app.lem: Och lat dyn grote weynent syn!
app.rdg: stop your excessive crying!

app.lem: Herteleue benedygede maget,
app.rdg: Beloved of my heart, Blessed Virgin,

app.lem: Hebbe eyn herte vnvorsaghet,
app.rdg: be courageous in heart

app.lem: Wente yd mochte nicht anders syn:
app.rdg: because it could not have been any other way:

app.lem: Dyn leue kynt moste lyden pyn
app.rdg: your dear child had to suffer pain

app.lem: Vor alle mynslyken kunne;
app.rdg: beyond all human understanding;

app.lem: Dar na schal yd myt wunne
app.rdg: afterward he shall rise blissfully

app.lem: Vpstan van dode vnde myt vrowden dy schynen
app.rdg: from the dead and appear to you

app.lem: Vnde alle den leuen jungeren synen;
app.rdg: and all the disciples in joy.

app.lem: Dat schu&esup;t an deme drudden dage.
app.rdg: That will happen on the third day.

app.lem: -- Lat, moder maget, dyne klage! --
app.rdg: Stop your lamentation, mother!

app.lem: Dar negest schal he ok to hemmel varen
app.rdg: After that, he shall ascend to Heaven

app.lem: Myt synen groten hemmelschen scharen;
app.rdg: together with his great heavenly host;

app.lem: In synes hemmelschen vaders trone
app.rdg: on his heavenly father’s throne

app.lem: Blyuet he ewychliken schone.
app.rdg: he blossoms in eternal beauty.

app.lem: Sancta Maria respondet
app.rdg: St. Mary responds:

app.lem: O Johannes, dat grote vnschuldige lydent syn
app.rdg: Oh, John, his great and innocent suffering

app.lem: Wundet so sere lijff vnde sele myn,
app.rdg: deeply wounds my body and soul,

app.lem: Dat yk mot weynen vnde scrygen
app.rdg: so that I must cry and wail

app.lem: Vnde kan des ok nicht vortygen.
app.rdg: and cannot refrain from it.

app.lem: Planctus vltimus beate Marie, quem facit bina vice
app.rdg: The last lamentation of Mary, which she does twice:

app.lem: Johannes, nuwer sone myn,
app.rdg: John, my new son,

app.lem: Ik medder vnde moder dyn
app.rdg: I am both your aunt and your mother,

app.lem: Bydde: help my weynen,
app.rdg: please, help me bewail

app.lem: Vnde klagen Cristum den reynen,
app.rdg: and lament the pure Christ,

app.lem: Synt weynent ys nu worden tijd!
app.rdg: since the time for lamentation has now come!

app.lem: Dorch aller werlde myssedaet
app.rdg: On account of all the world’s misdeeds,

app.lem: De hemmel an drofnissen stat,
app.rdg: Heaven is in a state of sorrow.

app.lem: Steyne, erde van vruchten stoten syk
app.rdg: Stones and earth tremble in misery

app.lem: Vmme Cristus do&esup;t so bytterlyk.
app.rdg: because of Christ’s bitter death.

app.lem: Grote swere an mynem herten lyt.
app.rdg: Great anguish befalls my heart.

app.lem: Maria post hoc dicit lacrimabiliter, vt sequitur
app.rdg: After that, Mary speaks tearfully as follows:

app.lem: O wy vnde we, dat ik gy wart gheboren!
app.rdg: Alas and alack that I ever was born!

app.lem: Ik hebbe myn herteleue truten kynt vorloren!
app.rdg: I have lost my dear beloved child!

app.lem: Dat ys my afgemordet ga&esup;r,
app.rdg: He has been taken away from me by murder,

app.lem: Dat hanget hijr bleek vnde do&esup;tva&esup;r!
app.rdg: so that he hangs here bleak and deathly pale.

app.lem: Leuen kyndere, ik byn van jammer also krank,
app.rdg: Dear children, I am so sick from anguish

app.lem: Dat my benomen ys de ganck!
app.rdg: that I cannot move anymore.

app.lem: Ik mach nu nicht mer ga&esup;n,
app.rdg: I cannot walk

app.lem: Ok nicht vp mynen voten sta&esup;n.
app.rdg: nor stand on my feet anymore.

app.lem: Myn herte wyl van yammer tobreken,
app.rdg: My heart wants to break from misery

app.lem: Myn munt mach ok nicht mer spreken.
app.rdg: and my mouth is no longer able to speak.

app.lem: Johannes, lose nu af den do&esup;k doch,
app.rdg: John, now loosen the cloth

app.lem: Den yk em vmme synen hylgen syden slo&esup;ch!
app.rdg: that I bound around his hips!

app.lem: Dar ys ynne dat hilge dure blot,
app.rdg: It is stained with the holy blood

app.lem: Dat vte synen depen wunden vlot.
app.rdg: that flowed from his deep wounds.

app.lem: Dat mochte noch vp desser erden

app.rdg: That will become a consolation to

app.lem: Mennigen mynschen to troste werden.

app.rdg: many people in this world.

app.lem: Hic Maria cadit ad terram præ nimio dolore, et Johannes soluit pannum leuansque matrem domini et dicit amicabiliter et consolatorie
app.rdg: Here, Mary falls to the ground in unbearable pain, and John unties the cloth and, helping up the Mother of God, speaks sympathetically and consolingly:

app.lem: Sta vp, Maria, mynes herten allerleueste trut,
app.rdg: Get up, Mary, dearest friend of my heart,

app.lem: Vnde troste doch dynen gar drouigen mot!
app.rdg: and find comfort for your despair!

app.lem: Dat ys des mynschen salicheyt eyn grot deyl,
app.rdg: It is of great importance to mankind’s salvation

app.lem: Dat gestoruen ys Jhesus Cristus, vnse gantze heyl.
app.rdg: that Jesus Christ, our saviour, has died.

app.lem: De mynsche moste syn vorloren,
app.rdg: Mankind would have been lost,

app.lem: Were vnse leue here van dy nicht geboren;
app.rdg: if our beloved Lord had not been born of you.

app.lem: Vmme vns armen wolde he mynsche werden:
app.rdg: For the sake of us poor ones he desired to become human:

app.lem: Dar to quam he vp erden
app.rdg: for this he came to earth,

app.lem: Nach der propheten sproke allermeyst,
app.rdg: in perfect accordance with the prophet’s teachings,

app.lem: Alse du suluen alderbest weyst.
app.rdg: as you know well yourself.

app.lem: He wolde den mynschen losen
app.rdg: Because of his benevolence, he wanted to deliver

app.lem: Vmme syne gude van der walt der bosen;
app.rdg: mankind from the power of evil

app.lem: Vnde ok vmme syne groten barmherticheyt
app.rdg: and because of his great munificence

app.lem: Heft he vordreuen vnse o&esup;lde leyt,
app.rdg: he ended our old sorrow

app.lem: Dat van vnsen ersten elderen quam,
app.rdg: that was handed down to us by our first ancestors;

app.lem: Alse vns de scrift secht, van Euen vnde van Adam.
app.rdg: as scripture tells us, it came from Eve and Adam.

app.lem: Dat he den dot ok gy gewan,
app.rdg: Because he has died for this

app.lem: Des scholen en louen sere vrowen vnde man.
app.rdg: he shall be praised by women and men.

app.lem: Reyne junckfrowe Maria, lat dyne klaghe!
app.rdg: Pure Virgin Mary, end your lamentation!

app.lem: He wa&esup;rlik wyl vpsta&esup;n in deme drudden daghe:
app.rdg: He will truly rise on the third day;

app.lem: So schaltu en myt groten vrowden seen,
app.rdg: thus you shall see him with joy greater

app.lem: Me&esup;r den mynslik herte kan denken vnde gheen.
app.rdg: than a human heart can think of or desire.

app.lem: Dar an denke, o moder gute
app.rdg: Think of this, o good mother,

app.lem: Vnde ga myt my an myne hute!
app.rdg: and go with me, in my care!

app.lem: Du schalt wesen de leue moter myn,
app.rdg: You shall be my dear mother;

app.lem: Ik wyl dy alle tijd vnderdanich vnde horsam syn;
app.rdg: I will be obedient and loyal to you for ever.

app.lem: De junghere vnses heren scholen dat merken,
app.rdg: The disciples of our Lord shall know it:

app.lem: Dat ik dat bewysen wyl myt wyllen, myt worden vnde ok myt werken.
app.rdg: I will prove it with my intention, words, and deeds.

app.lem: Sancta Maria respondet voce lamcrimabili vltimo dicens
app.rdg: St. Mary finally responds, speaking in a tearful voice:

app.lem: Yohannes, myner leuen suster kynt,
app.rdg: John, my dear sister’s child,

app.lem: Wij altomale sere bedrouet synd,
app.rdg: all of us are very sad,

app.lem: Alse du wol west, vmme vnses leuen heren, mynes leuen kyndes do&esup;t.
app.rdg: as you well know, because of our dear Lord’s and my dear child’s death.

app.lem: Yk weyt dat wol, dat he desse marter grot
app.rdg: I well know that he has suffer.

app.lem: Gheleden heft vor alle de werld gemeyne.
app.rdg: his torment for all the world

app.lem: Hic vertit se ad filium
app.rdg: Here she turns to her son:

app.lem: O leue here Jhesu Criste, ik bevele my dy alleyne
app.rdg: O dear Lord Jesus Christ, I commend myself to you alone

app.lem: Vnde sunte Johanse, deme leuen junghere dyn;
app.rdg: and to St. John, your dear disciple;

app.lem: He mot nu vor dy myn kynt syn.
app.rdg: he will now be my child in your place.

app.lem: Van weynende vnde van suchtende kan ik nicht mer spreken,
app.rdg: From wailing and from suffering I can no longer speak;

app.lem: Myn arme herte wyl mydden entwey breken.
app.rdg: my poor heart wants to break in half.

app.lem: O Jhesu Criste, mynes herten allerleueste kynt,
app.rdg: O Jesus Christ, dearest child of my heart,

app.lem: Troste vns vnde alle, de nu vmme dy bedrouet synt!
app.rdg: comfort us and everyone who is grieving for you!

app.lem: Dyn hilge lydent mote vns syn to vromen,
app.rdg: Your holy suffering might help us

app.lem: Dat wij altomale moten in dat ewyge leuent komen!
app.rdg: so that we, together, can gain eternal life

app.lem: Johannes, leue truten sone myn,
app.rdg: John, dear beloved son,

app.lem: Ik wyl dy to allen tyden horsam vnde vnderdanich syn.
app.rdg: I will be loyal and obedient to you forever.

app.lem: Sanctus Johannes concludit post hoc planctum beate Marie virginis deuotissimum, dicens
app.rdg: St John then concludes this very pious lamentation of the Blessed Virgin, saying:

app.lem: O leuen vrundes, gij hebben gehort an dessem guden dage
app.rdg: O dear friends, on this good day you have heard

app.lem: Vnses heren lydent vnde vnser leuen vrowen klage!
app.rdg: our Lord’s suffering and the lamentation of our dear lady!

app.lem: Ere hilge lydent mote vns allen syn to vromen,
app.rdg: Her holy suffering may help us all,

app.lem: Dat wij altomale moten in dat ewyge leuent komen
app.rdg: so that we may all gain eternal life

app.lem: Vnde myt Marien mogen in deme hemmelryke
app.rdg: and, together with Mary, we may behold in Heaven

app.lem: Beschowen Jhesum Cristum vnsen leuen heren ewychlyken.
app.rdg: our dear and eternal Lord Jesus Christ.

app.lem: Dat vns dat altomale beschee,
app.rdg: In order for that to happen for us all

app.lem: So stat vp vnde gat sytten vppe juwe beyde knee,
app.rdg: stand up and kneel down,

app.lem: Spreket eyn pater noster myt ynnicheyt
app.rdg: say the Lord’s prayer piously

app.lem: Vnde ok aue Maria to juwer selen zalicheyt.
app.rdg: and also an ave Maria for your salvation.

app.lem: Ik bevele juw gode vnde sunte Marien.
app.rdg: I commend you to God and St. Mary.

app.lem: Dar mede wylle wij vnse klagent vortygen.
app.rdg: With this we want to end our lamentations.

app.lem: Post hoc vnusquisque ponit se ad genua cum omnibus circumstantibus deuote, et sanctus Johannes dicit collectam sequentem alta voce pro omnibus: Oremus!
app.rdg: After this, everyone, together with all the bystanders, devoutly kneels, and in a loud voice, St. John recites the following offertory for everyone: Let us pray!

app.lem: Interueniat pro nobis quesumus, domine Jhesu Criste, nunc et in hora mortis nostre apud tuam immensam clemenciam beatissima virgo Maria, cuius felicissimam animam in hora amare passionis tue gladius doloris pertransiuit!
app.rdg: O Lord Jesus Christ, we beseech you that the blessed Virgin Mary, your mother, whose most holy soul was pierced by the sword of sorrow in the hour of your passion, may appeal for us to your clemency, now and at the hour of our death. Prayer taken from the Officium parvum de septem Doloribus B.V.M.

app.lem: Coniunctim
app.rdg: Together:

app.lem: Beati Johannis apostoli tui et ewangeliste nos quesumus tibi votiua commendat oracio. cui moriens in cruce matrem virginem virgini commendasti.
app.rdg: We beseech St. John, your apostle and our evangelist, to whom you, dying on the cross, have entrusted your mother, the virgin of virgins,

app.lem: Qui viuis et regnas cum deo patre in vnitate spiritus sancti, dues per omnia secula seculorum.
app.rdg: to commit the offered prayer to you, who lives and reigns with the Father in the unity of the Holy Spirit, God for all eternity.

app.lem: Omnes dicunt
app.rdg: All say:

app.lem: Amen.
app.rdg: Amen

app.lem: Johannes ewangelista statim extendit manum suam et benedicens omnem populum cum eadem benedictione quam dicit sacerdos finito sermone.
app.rdg: John the Evangelist immediately reaches out his hand and blesses all the people with the same benediction that the priest says at the end of a sermon.

app.lem: Vltimo rector incipit psalmum "Tenebre face sunt", cum quo vadunt usque ad summum altare ordinate et deuote et simul omnes cantant vsque ad versum.
app.rdg: Finally, the rector strikes up the psalm “Darkness fell,” to which all proceed in an orderly and devout manner to the high altar and sing together up until the verse.

app.lem: Quo finito omnes inclinant se ad gloriosissimum sacramentum humiliter.
app.rdg: When this has ended, they all bow humbly to the glorious Sacrament.

app.lem: Post hoc vnusquisque vadit vias cum gratiarum actione.
app.rdg: After this, everyone exits with displays of gratitude.

app.lem: Nota: Quando exeunt primo, cantant psalmum sequens
app.rdg: Note: When they first enter the stage, they sing the following psalm:

app.lem: Circumdederunt me viri mendaces, sine causa flagellis ceciderunt me.
app.rdg: Lying men surrounded me: without reason they beat me with whips;

app.lem: Sed tu, domine defensor, vindica me!
app.rdg: But you Lord, my defender, avenge me.

app.lem: Dominus Jhesus solus cantat versum
app.rdg: The Lord Jesus Christ alone sings the verse:

app.lem: Quoniam tribulacio proxima est et non est, qui adiuvet.
app.rdg: For tribulation is very near: for there is none to help me.

app.lem: Quando intrant, cantant responsorium sequens
app.rdg: When they exit the stage, they sing the following responsory:

app.lem: Tenebre facte sunt, dum crucifixissent Jhesum Judei.
app.rdg: Darkness fell when the Jews crucified Jesus

app.lem: Et circa horam nonam exclamauit Jhesus voce magna: Deus meus, Deus meus, vt quid me dereliquisti?
app.rdg: And about the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice:“My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?”

app.lem: Et inclinato capite tradidit spiritum.
app.rdg: And he bowed his head and gave up the ghost.

app.lem: Et sic est finis huius planctus.
app.rdg: And this is the end of this lamentation.
